channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump is withdrawing from the Paris Agreement (again), reversing U.S. climate policy
item.description: President Trump issued a barrage of orders Monday targeting Biden-era initiatives on global warming. The decisions come on the heels of the hottest year ever recorded.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump issued a barrage of orders Monday targeting Biden-era initiatives on global warming. The decisions come on the heels of the hottest year ever recorded.

(Image credit: Sean Gallup)
item.dc:creator: Nate Perez

item.title: Ex-Georgia prosecutor on trial for hindering Ahmaud Arbery's murder investigation
item.description: Former district attorney Jackie Johnson is accused of interfering with the police investigation into the shooting death of Ahmaud Arbery, nearly five years after he was murdered while jogging.
item.content:encoded:
Former district attorney Jackie Johnson is accused of interfering with the police investigation into the shooting death of Ahmaud Arbery, nearly five years after he was murdered while jogging.

(Image credit: Michael Hall)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: PHOTOS: President Trump attends several balls to close out Inauguration Day
item.description: Trump closed out his appearances at both balls with his signature dance to the Village People's "YMCA," who performed the song live at the Liberty Ball.
item.content:encoded:
Trump closed out his appearances at both balls with his signature dance to the Village People's "YMCA," who performed the song live at the Liberty Ball.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Taliban announce release of two Americans held in Afghanistan in a prisoner exchange
item.description: Afghanistan's Taliban government announced on Tuesday the release of two Americans in a prisoner exchange.
item.content:encoded:
Afghanistan's Taliban government announced on Tuesday the release of two Americans in a prisoner exchange.

(Image credit: Anna Corbett/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Ohio State defeats Notre Dame 34-23 in college football championship game
item.description: Ohio State dominated most of the night, and all through the playoffs
item.content:encoded:
Ohio State dominated most of the night, and all through the playoffs

(Image credit: Brynn Anderson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump orders end of humanitarian parole for migrants of four countries
item.description: Under the Biden administration, migrants from embattled countries could apply for entry due for humanitarian reasons, without having to attempt to cross into the U.S. illegally.
item.content:encoded:
Under the Biden administration, migrants from embattled countries could apply for entry due for humanitarian reasons, without having to attempt to cross into the U.S. illegally.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Trump rescinds Biden's census order, clearing a path for reshaping election maps
item.description: President Trump revoked a Biden-era executive order that affirmed the longstanding practice of including the total number of persons residing in each state in a census count used for election maps.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump revoked a Biden-era executive order that affirmed the longstanding practice of including the total number of persons residing in each state in a census count used for election maps.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Trump declares U.S. will withdraw from the World Health Organization
item.description: The newly inaugurated president has announced his intention to terminate U.S. membership in the U.N.'s global health agency.
item.content:encoded:
The newly inaugurated president has announced his intention to terminate U.S. membership in the U.N.'s global health agency.

(Image credit: Fabrice Coffrini)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Trump signs executive order to pause TikTok ban, provide immunity to tech firms
item.description: The order follows TikTok going dark for about 14 hours after the Supreme Court upheld a law prohibiting the service from operating in the U.S. unless it breaks away from its parent company in China.
item.content:encoded:
The order follows TikTok going dark for about 14 hours after the Supreme Court upheld a law prohibiting the service from operating in the U.S. unless it breaks away from its parent company in China.

(Image credit: Ashley Landis)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: PHOTOS: What we saw on Inauguration Day
item.description: On the day of President Donald Trump's second inauguration, thousands of supporters gathered in Washington, D.C. Take a look at what our photographers captured.
item.content:encoded:
On the day of President Donald Trump's second inauguration, thousands of supporters gathered in Washington, D.C. Take a look at what our photographers captured.

(Image credit: Brian Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Brian Munoz
